tr.td: This is a Questionnaire example of how the Connor Davidson Resilience Scale 25-item Questionnaire could be rendered as a FHIR Questionnaire Resource according to the Structured Data Capture SDC Base Questionnaire Profile. This example also portrays how FHIRpaths can be used to perform total score calculations using answer values.

description.value: The answer list for questions addressing the frequency in which patient reports experiencing behaviors that are assessed in the PPS10 Questionnaire.

This is a Questionnaire example of how the Connor Davidson Resilience Scale 25-item Questionnaire could be rendered as a FHIR Questionnaire Resource according to the Structured Data Capture SDC Base Questionnaire Profile. This example also portrays how FHIRpaths can be used to perform total score calculations using answer values.

purpose.value: This Questionnaire example was generated to ensure a non-proprietary, publicly available questionnaire that is available to test the Structured Data Capture profiles

text.value: Below are twenty-five statements that people often use to describe themselves. For each statement, please rate how well it describes you over the past month by selecting a number from 0 to 4 that best reflects your answer.
Sometimes fate or God can help
Past success gives confidence for new challenge
See the humorous side of things
Tend to bounce back after illness or hardship
When things look hopeless, I donâ€™t give up
Know where to turn for help
Under pressure, focus and think clearly
Prefer to take the lead in problem solving
Think of self as strong person
You work to attain your goals

description.value: Score (0-4: None-minimal; 5-9: Mild; 19-14: Moderate; 15-19: Moderately severe; 20-27: Severe)
